          • Co-Convenor (Jul '21 - Apr '22)• Convenor (Aug '20 - May '21)• Governor  (May '19 - Jul '20)• Secretary (Aug '18 - Apr '19)• Associate (Aug '17 - Jul '18)Communiqué is the official soft skills & personality development society of IIT Kharagpur.Governor (May '19 - Jul '20):• Held the highest position of responsibility in the official soft skills of IIT Kharagpur while leading a team of 60+ members from UG and PG batches.• Served as the Corporate Relations & Events Head and planned out year-long soft skills & personality development activities for 12,800+ students.• Co-authored two books on Guesstimates and Soft Skills for placement preparation; Received subscription from over 2000 students on campus.• Created & headed the sponsorship wing of the society. Raised a sponsorship amount of INR 300k for conducting year-long informative events.• Spearheaded and managed a Microsoft Training event while inviting over 3000 students from inside and outside the campus for 3 day-long sessions.• Lauded by the Director and Dean for executing outstanding and remarkable initiatives for the personality development of over 10,000 IIT students.
            

    
    

    
        Show less

volunteer_experience.info:
• Associate Manager (Oct '18 - Apr '19)• Associate Member (Feb '18 - Sep '19)Entrepreneurship Cell IIT Kharagpur is the most active student-run non-profit organization in India fostering the spirit of entrepreneurship in order to create a Self-Reliant India.• Worked extensively to promote the entrepreneurial culture in India through more than 35 events, indirectly supporting 40,000+ startup enthusiasts.• Planned and organized GES (Global Entrepreneurship Summit), the…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          • Associate Manager (Oct '18 - Apr '19)• Associate Member (Feb '18 - Sep '19)Entrepreneurship Cell IIT Kharagpur is the most active student-run non-profit organization in India fostering the spirit of entrepreneurship in order to create a Self-Reliant India.• Worked extensively to promote the entrepreneurial culture in India through more than 35 events, indirectly supporting 40,000+ startup enthusiasts.• Planned and organized GES (Global Entrepreneurship Summit), the largest student-level entrepreneurial summit in India at IIT Kharagpur.• Handled over 25 events in GES that saw the participation of over 10,000 students and over 2000 + startups from across various parts of India.• Conducted Emprasario, India's 1st business model competition with a cash prize of INR 25 lakh and 200 startups across various colleges.• Ideated a new event called Innovation Conclave to help commercialize the ongoing research projects from various departments of IIT Kharagpur.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
volunteer_experience.subtitle: Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur
volunteer_experience.title: Associate Manager

volunteer_experience.info: Prodex is the students' Initiative on Product Design and Hardware Modelling on campus!I worked in a team to develop a product that converted the heat energy from rural stoves into electrical energy which could be used in a device that enabled the students to study in dark in the absence of electricity. I acquired the skills of product designing and Hardware Modelling while getting acquainted with various product designing software.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: ProDex IIT Kharagpur
volunteer_experience.title: Associate

volunteer_experience.info: • Unit Leader (Aug '17 - Jul '18)• Student Volunteer (Aug '18 - Apr '19)National Service Scheme is an Indian government-sponsored public service program conducted by the Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports of the Government of India. I supervised 32 members in conducting various activities for the social cause and helped in the construction of sanitation pits in the nearby village during the NSS winter camp in 2017.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: National Service Scheme
volunteer_experience.title: Unit Leader

projects: [{"title":"E-waste management in India: user awareness, challenges, financial sustainability and future prospects","start_date":"May 2021","end_date":"Apr 2022"},{"title":"Improving the learning outcomes (Foundational literacy and Numeracy) in Uttar Pradesh","start_date":"Sep 2021","end_date":"Sep 2021"},{"title":"Migration Policy Reform and Patenting within Multinational Firms","start_date":"Nov 2020","end_date":"Dec 2020","description":"• Analyzed the impact of the company with the rates of inter-country Migration, by working on a dataset with 3mn+ records comprising 350k+ companies and using a Hybrid Fuzzy-Manual Mapping algorithm• Quantitatively modeled the mobility of ~2000 Corporate professionals with ties to a prominent NIFTY50 company with an m-cap of USD 70bn+ associating the key drivers with their Educational Institute and its location, size of company, industry, founding year, etc.• Modeled the effect of how distance correlates with Innovation by analyzing 500,000+ patents to identify “Innovation Hotspots” through Geospatial Mapping of the authors and citations and cross-referencing this with ~4,000 busiest airports."},{"title":"National Policy for Monetisation and Endogenisation of Transport Infrastructure Projects","start_date":"May 2019","end_date":"Jul 2019","description":"The policy paper aims at exploring various tools under Value Capture Finance, Financial Market Instruments, and Innovative Project Financing as alternative means of monetizing the development of transport infrastructure in India. Further, it addresses the current policy level and ground-level challenges in the infrastructure sector and concludes with the recommendations to build a sustainable, efficient, people-centric, and financially profitable infrastructure in India with clarity among all the stakeholders."},{"title":"Development of the infrastructure of autonomous carrier shuttles in Indian Universities.","start_date":"Nov 2018","end_date":"Nov 2018","description":"The project aims to develop a plan of building the infrastructure of autonomously controlled & dynamically programmed carriers shuttles inside the campus of Indian universities."},{"title":"Why is graphene worth taking look at? Challenges lying in front and future aspects","start_date":"Nov 2018","end_date":"Nov 2018","description":"The paper aims as exploring the useful properties of Graphene with a potential application in diverse industries while addressing the current technical and financial challenges in its wide-scale use. It looks forward to transforming the manufacturing industry using the mechanically and chemically unique Graphene."},{"title":"Local Startup Meet Delhi 2018","start_date":"Oct 2018","end_date":"Oct 2018","description":"Local Startups Meet is a massive PAN India drive of Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur aimed at cultivating the spirit of entrepreneurship among the youth across over 25 cities.I conducted Local Startup Meet (LSM) 2018 in New Delhi in the month of Oct 2018 with an objective to address real-life problems that a startup faces in its journey. Eminent investors, venture capitalists, and top-notch entrepreneurs were invited, who shared their experiences through a series of panel discussions, pitching sessions and a lean startup drive. While leading a team of 10 students from different colleges of Delhi, I had the responsibility to look after the outreach partners, media associations, sponsorship and overall management of the event."}]
